122212.content:
(Remember that this takes place before the Advanced Generation season, when May replaces Misty.)

It started out like another day for Ash, Brock, and Misty. Brock cooked breakfast, Ash was searching for new Pokemon with with Pikachu, and Misty was fishing by the lake. Though after awhile, Misty became bored with fishing and was heading back to the camp where Brock and Ash were, but then her Psyduck came out of his pokeball again. She grabbed her pokeball to return him, but she dropped it after Psyduck was back in his pokeball. As she bent down to pick up Psyduck's pokeball, she felt a chill down her spine as she discovered something she should have realized earlier. She had developed a potbelly big enough to make it difficult to see her feet.

She panicked mentally and let out a small but high pitched shriek as tried to figure out how she could have gained this weight. Then she began to remember that she had been traveling to many restaurants with Ash recently. Whenever she was with Ash at those restaurants, she was free to eat like a pig because she knew that Ash never cared about how Misty ate. He always ate like a pig too, but he hadn't developed a big belly like her because he was a little more active than Misty. He would try to find Pokemon by walking through the woods or anywhere else, while Misty mostly tried to catch water Pokemon in the closest lake.

"I can't believe how much I've let myself go! I've got to do something to get rid of this weight. I know I'll start by jogging! That'll help me lose a few pounds."

Misty did jog, but her jog didn't last long. She never did too much jogging before, and she wasn't used to her new weight yet, which would make things difficult for Misty. She soon was out of breath after a few minutes. Though Misty felt like she had been running for an hour or longer, which helped convince her that she made progress in weight lose and that she didn't need to jog anymore today. So Misty decided to return to the camp.

151121.content:
Wonder Woman had just emerged from the shower, a towel wrapped around her still drying body, when Athena, the Goddess of Wisdom, suddenly appeared in her room on the watchtower.

"Greetings Diana of Themiscara, the gods have a trial for you to undertake."

Diana, having bowed as soon as she recognized her goddess, nodded.

"And I am willing to go through whatever the gods want me to."

"That is well, for this trial will be most arduous. You have noticed, no doubt, the way that Man's World often idealizes thinness, the size of a woman's breasts, and other such loathsome customs have you not?"

Diana nodded.

"For your trial, you will slowly change into something quite the opposite. You will be incredibly fat, with stenches that the pits of Hades could not conjure up pouring from your mouth, buttocks, and even the pores of your skin. You will become lazy, almost sedentary, wanting nothing more than to curl up on a couch and eat to your heart's content. And, finally, you will face your foes in combat in this form and interact among your friends as well. Those of your female heroes who wish to be like you will find themselves changing to match your new form. Do you still accept?"

Diana's mind was whirling from this information. Give up her warrior's body, toned and fit after hundreds of years of combat? What would her friends say? What would Bruce say if they saw what she would become if she went along with this? Eventually though, Diana nodded and replied.

"Yes, I shall prove to Man's World that a woman does not have to be thin, or cleanly, or even smell nice to make a difference. Change me as the gods will."

Athena nodded, smiling warmly at Diana.

"Very well. When I vanish the changes will begin. Your changes will cease after a month, in which time your female friends can also be changed. Good luck Diana."

And with that, Athena vanished, leaving Diana in her towel and now dry body.

As she changed into her normal clothes...
151121.title: Wonder Woman

choices: Diana finds a friend and goes back to the restaurant.

1511211.content:
Diana heard her stomach rumble, but not like before. Her stomach's growl was loud enough to echo through out Wonder Woman's room. It was obvious that the first change Athena had mentioned was an increase in her hunger, so Diana had to obey Athena and her stomach to go get some food. Luckily for her, there was a new restaurant she had heard about.

Later Diana stood in front of the new restaurant called Food from Paradise. It was a large restaurant with a green colored walls, food shaped windows, and doors big enough for an elephant to go through. As she entered through the large door, she looked around and saw that restaurant was nearly empty. There were only a few waitresses walking around or looking bored, until they saw Diana. A waitress rushed over to her, and quickly showed her to a table. "Welcome to Food from Paradise! You're the first customer, so you get meals half off for the next month." said the waitresses.

"Thank you that's very generous." said Wonder Woman thinking that this would make it easier for her accomplish her goal and impress Athena. "Though there is one more small requirement in order to get half off on your meals for the next month. All you have to do is bring some friends or recommend our restaurant to other people with you next time." said the waitress.

"You're asking me to help bring in more customers for your restaurant?" said Diana surprised that a fine looking restaurant would actually ask her to help their business.

"Well the problem is that our competition has already spread rumors about our food. They say that our food is either rotten or has no flavor. So why don't you try some of our food and see what our food is really like." said the waitress with a smile as she handed Diana a menu.

Diana quickly peered through the menu and instinctively knew what to order. "I would like some bacon, french fries, baked beans, and a large steak." said Diana. The waitress wrote down her order and went to the kitchen to talk to the chef.

Later Diana saw her waitress return with her order from the kitchen. The food looked so good to Diana that she began to drool as the waitress approached. As soon as the food was set on the table Diana munched and chewed with lightning fast speed. She grabbed large handfuls of the beans and French fries first. Once she had run out of beans and fries Diana let out a small fart, which caused the waitress to take a step back. Once she let out her fart she continued eating, and started consuming the bacon. The grease from the bacon drip on to her clothes, but she didn’t care one bit. Soon the bacon was gone as well and all that was left was the enormous and juicy steak. Diana was about to pick up her fork and knife to cut the steak into pieces yet a part of her told her that the silverware near her wasn’t necessary. So she decided to just pick up the steak and began ripping off pieces of it with her mouth almost like a wild animal.

Later she finished the steak and felt stuffed. She kinda enjoyed being able to pig out like that. It felt like she had freed herself from some of the customs of a stereotype for women. The waitress on the other hand was a little repulsed by Diana. The waitress handed Diana a check and guided her towards the door. After Diana left the waitress began to talk to her friend. “So Amanda, how did it go with the first customer?” asked one of the other waitresses. “Okay, but she acted sort of like a slob. I hope that if she decides to bring her friends so she gets half off, her friend won’t be as gross as her.” said Amanda as she continued her conversation with her fellow waitress. “I don’t think she was that bad. I admit I wish I could be able to get away with acting like a slob.” Amanda just stared at her friend with disbelief at that last statement.

Later Wonder Woman had returned home and realized something on her way back. She gained about ten pounds on her way back. Athena trail must increase her weight gain exponentially. Right now Diana was too tied to care though and went straight to bed.

The next day…

1511212.content:
Diana stood in her bedroom for several minutes looking at herself in the mirror. She turned and examined herself from the side and took a good long look at her behind as she looked over her shoulder at her reflection. Diana was trying to picture herself with these changes Athena had commanded of her but Diana just wasn't sure she could do it. Diana admitted there was some vanity in this admiration of her toned well trained body but it was something she had worked long and hard for turning herself into a perfectly balanced instrument of justice.

"Hera help me" Diana whispered under her breath, She didn't understand Athena's plans, they didn't make any sense to her. However Diana knew she was just an amazon and it was her sworn duty to serve the goddess faithfully. Surely Athena's plan was just more than her human mind could comprehend. Athena must have all of this figured out... even if Diana didn't understand a bit of it.

--------
Meanwhile on mount Olympus a quick footed blur rushed into Athena's courtyard and into her home. Carefully it laid her helmet down on her mantle and tried to exit swiftly when a spear came flying across the room and planted itself in the path of this shadowy figure.

"Hermes!" Athena bellowed "What were you doing with my golden helmet!?"

"Oh Athena, it's nothing to worry about" Hermes chuckled as he tried to step around the spear "I merely needed to borrow it for a moment, no harm done"

"Yes I'm sure" Athena narrowed her eyes at the messenger god "Off pulling pranks again no doubt!"

"Me?" Hermes shook his head "my trickster days are behind me, what reason could I have to impersonate you?"

"I intend to find out!" Athena called out as she sprinted for her spear and wrenched it loose. Hermes cried out in terror and took off as fast as his winged boots could move with the goddess close behind him.

--------
"uuuuuuap" a light expulsion of pressure from Diana's stomach escaped her lips as she finished drinking an entire bottle of orange juice. "How do these mortals do it?" Diana sighed, she had seen them before, at the scene of their heroics, walking down the street. Humans, fat and lazy, clothing that no longer fit properly, unkempt hair or lacking in hygiene. How these people had gotten so slovenly was always a mystery to her. The very concept of gluttony or slothfulness were something Diana had ever really had to worry about. Even now despite her efforts to carry our her goddess's wishes her apartment was supplied with nothing but healthy foods and devoid of any distractions such as a television or even a couch to relax on. Her domicile was kept neat, she worked out everyday in her home and often took trips to the watchtower to utilize it's super human equipped gym.

Diana was really not sure how to go against her lifestyle, the only lifestyle she knew. Diana decided if she was going to fulfill Athena's commands she would have to learn how to live like someone she was destined to become.

15112121.content:
The next day, at breakfast, Diana was in agony. It wasn't from any wound an old foe had given her, no, it was the amazon's stomach, growling for sustenance. The health food that filled her larders caused her to recoil in disgust. Yesterday she would have been content with the food she normally had. But her stomach wanted something else, an image soon appearing in her mind. Golden arches. Mcdonald's, Diana thought to herself.

Twirling around until she was in her civilian identity, Diana walked a few blocks from her apartment to a nearby Mcdonalds, going inside. The scent of frying grease and salt came to her nostrils, sending her stomach into overdrive as it roared.

Approaching the relatively empty counter, Diana looked at the menu and vast array of unhealthy food to devour.

"I'll have ten of your hashbrowns, six egg mcmuffins, and...oh, you're serving lunch now to?"

The employee nodded.

"Give me five Big Mac Meals please, as large as you can make them."

Again, the employee nodded. Diana wasn't quite sure why she ordered that much food but her stomach was more in command at the moment, the start of the gift from Athena no doubt.

When the food arrived, Diana took all of the trays with her to a booth and dug in.

It...was...heaven!

She had never tasted food that brought her tastebuds alive quite like this before! A whole hashbrown went into her mouth, followed by a might slurp of Dr.Pepper. Letting fly a mighty belch after that, Diana resumed her eating with even more vigor, her stomach no longer roaring to be filled.

**************************************************************************** ******************************************************************************** *******************************

Athena watched as her champion gorged herself like Bacchus at the festival and sighed.

Hermes had indeed tricked Diana. But there was only one thing Athena could do, as gods could not undo what another god had already put into motion: she had to go along with this transformation. Which meant a change to her own lifestyle.

She would indeed appear before Diana again, but with a bit more meat on her non-mortal bones.

"Fetch me a container of ambrosia," she ordered one of her followers. The spirit went away, soon returning with her request. Athena sighed again as she swallowed the contents of the container in one fell swoop, a slight divine belch escaping her perfectly formed lips.

15112122.content:
After a few days of Searching Diana found her ideal roommate, which is to say, she found the worst roommate possible by normal standards. Diana naturally had no desire to share her home with a man and started advertising for her apartment at the local grocery and at the park where she sometimes jogged. But As Diana soon found out the healthy markets and public park didn't seem to be the type of place her target frequented. Through trial and error Diana found she got more overweight respondents if she posted her flyers near a fast food restaurant or at stores that sold larger sizes of clothing. As well Diana had begun her search offering a fair share of the rent and even split of the chores to be done as was only natural to her. But she saw a trend in the less active applicants who wanted to bargain for paying a smaller portion of the rent or expressed displeasure at doing chores. Diana had never considered the idea of someone doing less and expecting a fair share like this but she saw it was exactly what she needed to find her perfect roommate.

As soon as Diana posted her search at the nearby Walmart/Mcdonalds offering no rent needed and no expectation to help pay for food Diana got exactly what she was looking for. Her name was Robin, she was 23 and weighed 296 pounds. She was a brunette with hair to her back and most of the weight was in her belly and hips. Diana soon learned she was kicked out of her last apartment for refusing to clean her dirty dishes and leaving her laundry in her roommate's baskets. The first thing she said when she entered the apartment for the interview was "What? No TV?"

Diana was repulsed by her attitude, Robin had no job, she was a highschool drop out, she constantly criticized Diana's food selection even while eating all of it. Diana was starting to wonder if this behavior was worth putting up with to learn how Robin lived to achieve her appearance. But Diana endured for her goddess.

It wasn't long before Diana gave up all control of the grocery list and agreed to buy whatever Robin felt the apartment needed. Within a week of Diana's call to service for Athena her apartment had been transformed. A large TV hung on the wall covering Diana's windows overlooking the city skyline. An extra large plush couch sat behind a new coffee table with drawers filled with candy bars. Her clean tidy apartment was gone, replaced with food wrappers scattered about and pushed into corners, food stained plus sized sweat pants draped over her lamps and a messy kitchen so overloaded with junk food and sweets it spilled out of the cabinets and over the counters. Bags of baked goods and deserts were spread out across the floor. Diana stood in disbelief at the spectacle her apartment now was.

Robin spent all day spread out on the couch watching trash TV and eating her own weight in junk food. A clear trail of wrappers and spills was forming between Robin's room, the couch, and the kitchen. Diana tried her best to keep up with the mess but between her own duties as a heroine and Robin's 24/7 lounging Diana was just not able to do so. What's more Diana had been so preoccupied with trying to keep up with her normal routine she was failing to begin emulating Robin.

15113211.title: Starfire

151132111.content:
After Blackfire's scheme with Glgrdsklechhh had failed, she was captured and sent to a prison on another planet. though it wasn't long before she managed to escape from the prison. The only thing that was on her mind when she escaped was revenge. She had conquered her home world, and had The Jewel of Charta to make her even stronger, yet somehow she was defeated by her little sister. All that hard work, scheming and deception were all now part of precious wasted time. She had to make her sister pay, but not by killing her. That would be too quick. She wanted to find a way to humiliate Starfire and permanently ruin her reputation as a hero.

Blackfire wasn't a fool though, she knew she needed to wait before she could get vengeance on Starfire. So she kept a low profile for a period of time. She waited about a month before she finally decided to get started on a plan to get her revenge. She had recently heard of a black market in a nearby galaxy that sold strange and dangerous items that might be useful in her scheme. So she traveled there once she gained the coordinates from some other intergalactic criminals.

When she finally arrived, she looked around the black market and saw a peculiar store. All the other stores only sold weapons and junk that would be useless if she wanted to get revenge on her sister. This was so far the only store that might have something that had potential to aid her with her plans. She entered the store and noticed the wide variety it had. There were weapons there like the other stores, but this one also had a variety of items she had never seen before. There were strange creatures in cages across the store, most of them looked like vicious animals that you wouldn't want to keep as pets. There were also gizmos of various sizes, ranging from primitive technology to super advanced machines. Blackfire was very impressed with the display and was certain that something here might be useful.

Then the store clerk appeared from a room in the back. He was an odd looking alien. He had purple skin, a body shaped like a stop sign, three eyes, a large mouth and skinny twig like arms and legs. "Hello. I can tell that you're impressed by my collection of goods from across the galaxy. If you want to buy something, just tell me what you what and I bet I'll have just what you're looking for."

In fact, there were a lot of times where she felt intimidated because everyone and everything around her was so much bigger than her. She knew she shouldn't feel that way, after all, she was only 6 years old, there was still plenty of time for her to grow.

She closed her eyes, and after several moments, the peaceful atmosphere and rhetoric warmth of the sun shining down on her caused her to fall asleep.
